thread.title: Afternoon Tea Week, London Eye and Where’s Wally hunts: The best things to do this week
thread.title_full: Afternoon Tea Week, London Eye and Where’s Wally hunts: The best things to do this week

title: Afternoon Tea Week, London Eye and Where’s Wally hunts: The best things to do this week
text:
Afternoon Tea Week, London Eye and Where’s Wally hunts: The best things to do this week Afternoon Tea Week, London Eye and Where’s Wally hunts: The best things to do this week GET ON board with Where’s Wally hunts, sweet treats and twilight panoramas this week. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sun, Aug 9, 2015 PH Enjoy a taste of the high life with the Coca-Cola London Eye’s Summer Lates evening 
SEE 
Sip cocktails by twilight and enjoy a taste of the high life with the Coca-Cola London Eye’s Summer Lates evenings. Take in stunning views of the city at dusk while sipping cocktails 135 metres above the capital during an hour-long double rotation of the London Eye. 
The Summer Cocktail Experience, which runs until August 21, costs £45 per person, including priority boarding, two cocktails and a 360-degree mini guide. Call 0871 781 3000 or visit londoneye.com . 
VISIT 
Take an enchanting trip to Staffordshire’s historic Shugborough Estate and discover hidden treasures on the Seven Secret Doors summer trail, which runs until September 7. Each secret door leads to a magical place in the gardens and each has something spellbinding behind it – whether it’s a place to hang the key to someone’s heart, a wishing arch or a Chinese tea party. 
This great summer holiday activity at the picturesque estate that inspired Lord Of The Rings author JRR Tolkien, costs £15 for adults and £9 for children. For details, visit shugborough.org.uk . 
EAT 
Help celebrate a great British tradition while indulging in a range of scrumptious treats. Afternoon Tea Week, which starts tomorrow, will see themed menus and special offers in hotels, tearooms and restaurants across the country, while a pop-up in London will host tea with celebrities, show demonstrations by leading pastry chefs and offer tea tastings and talks. 
Elsewhere, a host of venues from five-star hotels and castles to stately homes and double-decker buses will be serving up afternoon delights to suit all budgets. For information, offers and how to book, see afternoonteaweek.com . 
TAKE PART 
Take the family on a nationwide Where’s Wally? hunt this summer and you could win a luxury weekend trip to London courtesy of Virgin Trains and SuperBreak. For six weeks, 100 life-sized Wallys will be hidden in cityscapes, train stations and trains along the West Coast Main Line. 
For a chance to win, just snap yourself with a Wally and, when you have spotted as many as you can, tweet the total number of Wallys found or enter on Virgin Trains’ Facebook page. See virgintrains.co.uk/family-offer . Related articles
